page.title: 19THE COASTLINE
page.content: Sanday being an island is completely surrounded by water. Two of our squares are entirely sea. Three squares have sea as their Primary land cover. There are two bays in our region one called{Backaskail Bay}and the other called{Kettletoft Bay.}Both bays have{sandy beaches.}What do we see there?{PLANTS:-}Some of the plants you usually see at the beach are {yellow-wort, water-violet, chaffweed and{thrift.}Also after each tide a large supply of different kinds of {seedweed}is to be found on the shore. {BIRDS:-}Down on the beach there are {fulmars}(mallimack);{eider-ducks (dunter);{oystercatcher}(skeldro); {great black-backed gull}(baakie); and {sandpiper}(boondie); to name but a few.{MAMMALS:-}Down in the bays we find a number of{common seals}known as selkies in Orkney.
